title: 108_hr3644
content: The Act titled "Homeland Security Technology Improvement Act of 2003" includes a section on the "Homeland Security Technology Transfer Program." The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to establish a multi-agency technology transfer program for State, regional, and local emergency agencies. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to establish a technology transfer program for emergency agencies, focusing on research, development, testing, and consultation with relevant agencies. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to establish a technology transfer program for emergency agencies. The program includes working with the National Institute of Standards and Technology, entering agreements with other Federal agencies, and utilizing technology transfer centers to provide a list of available technologies to the Office for Domestic Preparedness. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to establish a technology transfer program for emergency agencies, working with the Secretary of Defense to deploy technologies for homeland security purposes. The Office for Domestic Preparedness will administer this program. The Director of the Office for Domestic Preparedness, in coordination with the Under Secretary for Science and Technology, will establish and administer a technology transfer program to provide counterterrorism and nonterrorism response technology, equipment, and information to State, regional, and local emergency agencies based on available technologies and identified needs. The technology transfer program will consult with various agencies and accept applications to improve homeland security capabilities. Approved technology, equipment, and information will be transferred to agencies along with appropriate training. The technology transfer program will work with State, regional, and local agencies to implement technology, equipment, and information for homeland security. An advisory committee of retired and active duty officers will advise on the program. The technology, equipment, and information transfer program budget is limited to 10% for administrative expenses. $50,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2005 to 2014 for this program.
